page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN YATTON
page.content: Although off the main Bristol to Western-super-Mare road, Yatton's narrow High street is always busy, mainly with traffic going to and from Clevedon and M5 motorway. There are no parking restrictions, which is a good thing for pedestrians, because the traffic is forced to slow down by parked vehicles.In some places the pavements are narrow and if a lorry passes you have to squeeze back against the wall. Yatton has had a railway station since 1841, and at one time was an important junction for Clevedon,Cheddar and Blagdon.Although the branch lines have closed, it is still busy,being an Avon Link station serving commuters to Weston and Bristol .In 1985 several steam-hauled trains went through Yatton to Celebrate the 150th anniversary of the Great Western Railway.
